questions.text: A 25-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to 2 days of abdominal pain and bloody diarrhea. Temperature is 37.1 C (98.8 F), blood pressure is 119/76 mm Hg, pulse is 92/min, and respirations are 16/min. There is abdominal tenderness with no rebound or guarding. Guaiac-positive bloody stools are detected on rectal examination. Stool cultures reveal an Escherichia coli strain that does not produce glucuronidase and does not ferment sorbitol on sorbitol-containing MacConkey agar. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of the toxin specific to these bacteria?

A person presents with pneumonia. His sputum was sent for culture. The bacterium obtained showed gram positive cocci in chains on microscopy and alpha haemolytic colonies on sheep agar. Which of the following will help in confirming the diagnosis?

46-year-old man comes to the OPD due to right shoulder pain. The pain started 2 months ago after the patient began working at a new warehouse where he frequently moves heavy boxes. On physical examination, external rotation of the right shoulder against resistance is painful, but there is no weakness. MRI reveals near complete tear of the right infraspinatus muscle. The absence of weakness in this patient is best explained by compensatory hypertrophy of which of the following muscles?
Which of the following muscle is supplied by the nucleus present beneath the area marked by the arrow in adjoining image?

A 52-year-old man has undergone lung transplantation. Two months after receiving lung transplant, he developed pulmonary symptoms and was diagnosed as having bilateral diffuse interstitial pulmonary pneumonitis and bronchiolitis. Which of the following etiological agent is responsible in this condition?

23-year-old comes to the ED with the feeling of food being stuck in the throat. Laryngoscopy reveals fish bone lodged in the left piriform recess. During retrieval of the fish bone, a nerve deep to the mucosa overlying the recess is damaged. Which of the following is most likely to be impaired in this patient as a result of his iatrogenic injury?
What is the maximum period of voluntary self-admission under the Mental Healthcare Act 2017?

A 7-year-old male child, weighing 29 kg, is brought to OPD with a category 3 wound after a dog bite. Currently, equine rabies immunoglobulin is available instead of human rabies immunoglobulin. What dosage should be given as post-exposure prophylaxis for this child?
All of the following structures are derived from the aponeurosis of the external oblique muscle except:
Which of the given statement is incorrect regarding the marked nerve in the given cadaveric image?
Which of the following enzymes simultaneously incorporates molecular oxygen and produces water?

Identify the incorrect statements: MODY3 is a defect in HNF1A N-acetyl cysteine acts by replenishing stores of intrahepatic glutathione Xeroderma pigmentosa is a defect in base excision repair Defective fumaryl-acetoacetate hydrolase enzyme is associated with type 2 tyrosinemia
Match the following:
Identify the layer of the retina.

A 35-year-old patient arrives at the hospital emergency department presenting with gastrointestinal distress. The patient complains of severe abdominal pain, frequent vomiting, and watery diarrhea. During the physical examination, the medical team observes that the patient's stools emit an unusual faint glow. The patient appears disoriented and fatigued. The medical history reveals that the patient attended a local festival the previous day and consumed various food items there. The following exposures might be contributing to which substance toxication?

A newborn infant presents with diarrhoea after consuming breast milk. The infant seems comfortable when given glucose and water but exhibits abdominal cramps, flatulence and excessive crying when after feed on breast milk. Which of the following conditions is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Congenital lactose intolerance results from a lack of lactase enzyme, leading to symptoms of abdominal cramps, vomiting, and lethargy after ingestion of lactose-containing breast milk.
  • ➤ Congenital lactose intolerance results from a lack of lactase enzyme, leading to symptoms of abdominal cramps, vomiting, and lethargy after ingestion of lactose-containing breast milk.

questions.text: A 26-year-old man presents with symptoms of muscle fatigue during moderate exercise. His dietary history reveals that he recently began consuming raw eggs daily as part of a high-protein regimen. Given his dietary changes, which enzyme deficiency is most likely contributing to his exercise intolerance?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Biotin deficiency, often due to raw egg consumption, can impair pyruvate carboxylase function, leading to decreased gluconeogenesis and resulting in exercise intolerance and fatigue.
  • ➤ Biotin deficiency, often due to raw egg consumption, can impair pyruvate carboxylase function, leading to decreased gluconeogenesis and resulting in exercise intolerance and fatigue.

questions.text: Among the following fatty acids, which one does not belong to the omega-6 (ω6) series?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Alpha-linolenic acid (ALA) is an omega-3 fatty acid, distinct from omega-6 fatty acids like arachidonic acid, gamma-linolenic acid, and linoleic acid, based on the location of the first double bond in the carbon chain.
  • ➤ Alpha-linolenic acid (ALA) is an omega-3 fatty acid, distinct from omega-6 fatty acids like arachidonic acid, gamma-linolenic acid, and linoleic acid, based on the location of the first double bond in the carbon chain.

questions.text: A 50-year-old man is admitted to the hospital following a severe motor vehicle accident. Despite initial stabilization, he succumbs to his injuries three days after the incident. During the postmortem examination, bleeding is noted on the surface of the brain that does not wash away with water. Which of the following is the most likely source of this bleeding?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Subarachnoid bleeding

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Subarachnoid hemorrhage can be identified postmortem by blood that remains intact and is not washed away by water, distinguishing it from other types of intracranial bleeding.
  • ➤ Subarachnoid hemorrhage can be identified postmortem by blood that remains intact and is not washed away by water, distinguishing it from other types of intracranial bleeding.

questions.text: A 20-year-old sexual assault victim is examined in a courtroom setting described as "in camera." What does this imply about the nature of the court proceedings?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Closed proceeding

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ "In camera" refers to a closed proceeding in court where only selected individuals are allowed to be present, ensuring the privacy of sensitive cases such as those involving sexual assault.
  • ➤ "In camera" refers to a closed proceeding in court where only selected individuals are allowed to be present, ensuring the privacy of sensitive cases such as those involving sexual assault.

questions.text: Match the following conditions to their corresponding colors of postmortem staining in forensic examinations: Conditions: Carbon Monoxide Poisoning Opium Poisoning Hydrogen Sulphide Poisoning Clostridium Perfringens Infection Colors: Bluish Green Cherry Red Bronze Black
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ # (In Aniline Deep blue as well as Red Brown colour can occur)

questions.text: A 50-year-old immunocompromised patient presents with chronic lung infection and abscesses. Gram stain and blood agar culture findings shown below. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Nocardia species

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Nocardia species are branching, filamentous, partially acid-fast bacteria that form dry, wrinkled colonies on blood agar and commonly affect immunocompromised patients.
  • ➤ Nocardia species are branching, filamentous, partially acid-fast bacteria that form dry, wrinkled colonies on blood agar and commonly affect immunocompromised patients.
  • ➤ Nocardia species

questions.text: A 18-year-old boy is brought to the hospital with a 2-week history of rapidly increasing swelling on his jaw, recurrent nosebleeds, weight loss, and generalized fatigue. Physical examination of the neck reveals firm, nontender lymph nodes. The mass is biopsied, the image is shown below. Which of the following best describes the genomic structure of the most likely causative virus?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most likely causative virus for this patient’s symptoms is Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), which has a double-stranded linear DNA genome. EBV is associated with Burkitt lymphoma and other lymphoproliferative disorders.
  • ➤ The most likely causative virus for this patient’s symptoms is Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), which has a double-stranded linear DNA genome.
  • ➤ EBV is associated with Burkitt lymphoma and other lymphoproliferative disorders.

questions.text: A 1-year-old patient came with complaints of fever with rash but the only specific point about the patient was that rash appeared after the disappearance of fever. What is the best diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 6thdisease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Roseola infantum, also known as sixth disease, is a common viral infection in young children, typically caused by human herpesvirus 6 (HHV-6). It often presents with a sudden high fever followed by a distinctive rash as the fever subsides.
  • ➤ Roseola infantum, also known as sixth disease, is a common viral infection in young children, typically caused by human herpesvirus 6 (HHV-6).
  • ➤ It often presents with a sudden high fever followed by a distinctive rash as the fever subsides.

questions.text: A 3-year-old child weighing 12 kg presents with loose motions. He is thirsty, drinks eagerly, has absent tears, and his skin pinch goes back slowly. What is the best treatment plan for this child?

options.label: C
options.text: 900 mL Oral Rehydration Solution (ORS) over 4 hours

options.label: D
options.text: 300 mL ORS per episode of loose stool

questions.correct_answer: C. 900 mL Oral Rehydration Solution (ORS) over 4 hours
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Children with some dehydration due to diarrhea should be rehydrated with oral rehydration solution (ORS) at 75 mL/kg over 4 hours. Accurate fluid replacement is essential for effective management and to prevent progression to severe dehydration.
  • ➤ Children with some dehydration due to diarrhea should be rehydrated with oral rehydration solution (ORS) at 75 mL/kg over 4 hours.
  • ➤ Accurate fluid replacement is essential for effective management and to prevent progression to severe dehydration.

questions.text: All of these are causes of bilious vomiting in a neonate at birth except?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis does not present at birth but rather around 4-8 weeks of life with non-bilious vomiting. In contrast, conditions like duodenal atresia, jejunal atresia, and meconium ileus can cause vomiting in the immediate neonatal period.
  • ➤ Infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis does not present at birth but rather around 4-8 weeks of life with non-bilious vomiting.
  • ➤ In contrast, conditions like duodenal atresia, jejunal atresia, and meconium ileus can cause vomiting in the immediate neonatal period.

questions.text: Which of the following descriptions does not accurately match the vaccine it pertains to?

options.label: A
options.text: Dengavaxia protects against all four serotypes of the dengue virus.

options.label: B
options.text: The leprosy vaccine MIP is administered alongside a dose of Rifampicin.

options.label: C
options.text: Mosquirix is an available vaccine against malaria caused by Plasmodium falciparum.

options.label: D
options.text: Covishield functions as a vaccine based on the receptor-binding domain of the spike protein.

questions.correct_answer: D. Covishield functions as a vaccine based on the receptor-binding domain of the spike protein.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Covishield functions as a vaccine based on the receptor-binding domain of the spike protein.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Covishield's viral vector technology is a key differentiator from other types of vaccines that might employ protein subunits or RBDs directly.

questions.text: Match the following institutions in Column A with their correct descriptions in Column B.
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ 1-b. Orphanages: Provide care for children who cannot be taken care of by their parents. 2-a. Foster Homes: These homes place children under the care of trained personnel. 3-d. Adoption: A legal process that confers full parental rights and responsibilities on adoptive parents. 4-c. Borstals: Institutions meant for boys over the age of 16 who require training and reform due to behavioral issues.
  • ➤ 1-b. Orphanages: Provide care for children who cannot be taken care of by their parents.
  • ➤ 1-b. Orphanages:
  • ➤ 2-a. Foster Homes: These homes place children under the care of trained personnel.
  • ➤ 2-a. Foster Homes:
  • ➤ 3-d. Adoption: A legal process that confers full parental rights and responsibilities on adoptive parents.
  • ➤ 3-d. Adoption:
  • ➤ 4-c. Borstals: Institutions meant for boys over the age of 16 who require training and reform due to behavioral issues.
  • ➤ 4-c. Borstals:
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Note:
  • ➤ Remand Homes: Institutions focused on mental and physical health support, often providing temporary housing and rehabilitation for children.
  • ➤ Remand Homes:

questions.text: Under which section of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS) is the McNaughten's Rule defined?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The McNaughten's Rule, concerning the legal defense of insanity, is defined under Section 22 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS) .
  • ➤ The McNaughten's Rule, concerning the legal defense of insanity, is defined under Section 22 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS) .
  • ➤ Section 22 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS)

questions.text: Which of the following is not a continuous cell line used for viral culture?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) WI-38

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ WI-38 is a diploid cell line with a limited lifespan , unlike continuous cell lines such as Vero, Hep2, and Hela, which can proliferate indefinitely in culture.
  • ➤ WI-38 is a diploid cell line with a limited lifespan , unlike continuous cell lines such as Vero, Hep2, and Hela, which can proliferate indefinitely in culture.
  • ➤ WI-38 is a diploid cell line with a limited lifespan

questions.text: A 40-year-old man presents with difficulty chewing on one side. On examination, there is reduced movement of the mandible due to impaired muscle function. Which of the following nerves, a branch of the anterior division of the mandibular nerve, is most likely affected?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Masseteric

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The masseteric nerve is a motor branch of the anterior division of the mandibular nerve (V3) and supplies the masseter muscle, which is essential for mastication. The anterior division primarily provides motor branches to the muscles of mastication, with the exception of the buccal nerve, which is sensory.
  • ➤ The masseteric nerve is a motor branch of the anterior division of the mandibular nerve (V3) and supplies the masseter muscle, which is essential for mastication.
  • ➤ masseteric nerve
  • ➤ The anterior division primarily provides motor branches to the muscles of mastication, with the exception of the buccal nerve, which is sensory.

questions.text: Which molecule is primarily responsible for transporting long-chain fatty acids into the mitochondria for beta-oxidation?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Carnitine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Carnitine facilitates the transport of long-chain fatty acids into the mitochondria via the carnitine shuttle, enabling beta-oxidation for ATP production, especially in energy-demanding tissues like cardiac muscle.
  • ➤ Carnitine facilitates the transport of long-chain fatty acids into the mitochondria via the carnitine shuttle, enabling beta-oxidation for ATP production, especially in energy-demanding tissues like cardiac muscle.

questions.text: Based on the provided kinetic model, what type of inhibition is most likely depicted?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Non-competitive

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Non-competitive inhibition occurs when an inhibitor binds to an allosteric site, reducing enzyme activity regardless of substrate concentration. This leads to a decreased Vmax without altering Km.
  • ➤ Non-competitive inhibition occurs when an inhibitor binds to an allosteric site, reducing enzyme activity regardless of substrate concentration.
  • ➤ Non-competitive inhibition
  • ➤ This leads to a decreased Vmax without altering Km.

questions.text: The incidence rate of a disease is five times higher in women than in men, but the prevalence rates are similar between the sexes. What is the most likely explanation for this observation?

options.label: A
options.text: The case fatality rate for this disease is lower in women

options.label: B
options.text: The case fatality rate for this disease is higher in women

options.label: C
options.text: The duration of the disease is shorter in men

options.label: D
options.text: Risk factors for developing the disease are more common in women

questions.correct_answer: B. The case fatality rate for this disease is higher in women
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When the incidence of a disease is significantly higher in one group, but prevalence remains the same, a shorter disease duration (due to higher case fatality or faster cure rates) in the group with higher incidence can explain the discrepancy.
  • ➤ When the incidence of a disease is significantly higher in one group, but prevalence remains the same, a shorter disease duration (due to higher case fatality or faster cure rates) in the group with higher incidence can explain the discrepancy.

questions.text: A 62-year-old man with known chronic renal and hepatic failure requires intubation for an elective surgery. Which of the following muscle relaxants is the most appropriate choice given his medical condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cis-atracurium is the preferred muscle relaxant in patients with renal and hepatic failure due to its Hofmann elimination mechanism, which allows safe use regardless of renal or liver function status.
  • ➤ Cis-atracurium is the preferred muscle relaxant in patients with renal and hepatic failure due to its Hofmann elimination mechanism, which allows safe use regardless of renal or liver function status.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about clozapine are true? Most common side effect is sedation WBC monitoring is required weekly for first 6 months It has highest risk of metabolic syndrome among antipsychotics Agranulocytosis is a dose-dependent side effect
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Clozapine is the drug of choice in treatment-resistant schizophrenia. It has strong affinity towards D4 and low affinity towards D2, which explains the lack of extrapyramidal side effects. It also acts as an antagonist at 5 HT2A, D1, D3 and ⍺-adrenergic receptors. Clozapine is the only antipsychotic that decreases the suicidal ideation.
  • ➤ Clozapine is the drug of choice in treatment-resistant schizophrenia.
  • ➤ It has strong affinity towards D4 and low affinity towards D2, which explains the lack of extrapyramidal side effects.
  • ➤ It also acts as an antagonist at 5 HT2A, D1, D3 and ⍺-adrenergic receptors. Clozapine is the only antipsychotic that decreases the suicidal ideation.

questions.text: A 25-year-old man with a history of solvent abuse presents with fatigue and frequent exposure to toluene. Laboratory tests reveal elevated hippuric acid in his urine. Hippuric acid is formed by the conjugation of which of the following compounds?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Benzoyl glycine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hippuric acid is formed by the conjugation of benzoic acid with glycine in the liver and is excreted in urine. It serves as a clinical marker for toluene exposure or benzoic acid metabolism.
  • ➤ Hippuric acid is formed by the conjugation of benzoic acid with glycine in the liver and is excreted in urine.
  • ➤ Hippuric acid
  • ➤ benzoic acid
  • ➤ glycine
  • ➤ It serves as a clinical marker for toluene exposure or benzoic acid metabolism.
  • ➤ toluene exposure

questions.text: Which of the following methods is most appropriate for quantitative analysis of the viral RNA genome?

options.label: C
options.text: Conventional PCR with Restriction Fragment Length Pair Technique

questions.correct_answer: A. RT-PCR followed by Real-time PCR
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) RT-PCR followed by Real-time PCR

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most appropriate method for quantitative analysis of viral RNA genomes is RT-PCR followed by Real-time PCR , which combines reverse transcription to convert RNA into cDNA and real-time fluorescence-based quantification during amplification.
  • ➤ The most appropriate method for quantitative analysis of viral RNA genomes is RT-PCR followed by Real-time PCR , which combines reverse transcription to convert RNA into cDNA and real-time fluorescence-based quantification during amplification.
  • ➤ quantitative analysis of viral RNA genomes
  • ➤ RT-PCR followed by Real-time PCR

questions.text: A 62-year-old man with a history of persistent hoarseness, difficulty swallowing, and weight loss is diagnosed with advanced cancer. As part of his treatment, he undergoes a surgical procedure. Following surgery, he is fitted with the device shown in the image. What is the most likely surgical procedure he underwent?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Laryngectomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Laryngectomy involves removal of the larynx and creation of a permanent tracheostoma. Post-operatively, a tracheoesophageal prosthesis can be used for voice rehabilitation to enable speech.
  • ➤ Laryngectomy involves removal of the larynx and creation of a permanent tracheostoma.
  • ➤ Post-operatively, a tracheoesophageal prosthesis can be used for voice rehabilitation to enable speech.

questions.text: Which of the following is the safety muscle of larynx?

A researcher is studying an enzyme involved in glucose metabolism that is notably inhibited by glucose-6-phosphate (G6P). This enzyme is likely to exhibit which of the following characteristics in most body tissues?

options.label: C
options.text: High Vmax and lack of inhibition by G6P

questions.correct_answer: B. Low Km and low Vmax
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Low Km and low Vmax

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Learn the kinetic properties of hexokinase, including low Km and low Vmax, and its inhibition by G6P, critical for regulating glucose metabolism in most tissues.
  • ➤ Learn the kinetic properties of hexokinase, including low Km and low Vmax, and its inhibition by G6P, critical for regulating glucose metabolism in most tissues.
  • ➤ The characteristics of Hexokinase and Glucokinase:
  • ➤ The characteristics of Hexokinase and Glucokinase:

questions.text: Match the incorrect pair:
Which of the following is true for dying declaration in India?

options.label: D
options.text: It remains valid if patient survives

questions.text: A 6-month-old boy is brought to the OPD due to poor feeding. His mother says that he has difficulty holding his head up while breastfeeding and his suckling seems weaker than usual. Weight is at the 5th percentile. Length and head circumference are tracking along the 25th percentile. Physical examination shows hepatomegaly and hypotonia in all 4 limbs. Cardiac auscultation shows a gallop rhythm, and chest x-ray reveals severe cardiomegaly. Muscle biopsy shows enlarged lysosomes containing periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)–positive material. Which of the following enzymes is most likely deficient in this patient?
According to the NAME criteria for Carney complex, which of the following is not typically seen?

A 40-year-old electrical worker is brought to the emergency department after sustaining a high-voltage electric shock at work. He reports muscle pain, weakness, and dark-colored urine since the incident. What is the most likely substance found in his urine?
Identify the type of hymen shown in the image?

A 30-year-old patient presents with multiple excoriations on their arms and chest. The patient reports an inability to stop picking at their skin despite repeated attempts. What is the most appropriate treatment for this condition?

Researchers are working to identify new targets for drug development to treat idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. After obtaining lung tissue samples from affected patients, they conduct a series of experiments to measure the expression and activity of various profibrotic proteins. The results for one such protein, galectin-3, are as follows: mRNA concentration: normal Protein concentration: increased Protein activity: intact Which of the following processes best explains these findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Mutation in the Galectin-3 promoter region

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased methylation of the Galectin-3 gene

options.label: C
options.text: Shortening of the Galectin-3 mRNA poly-(A) tail

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased ubiquitination of the Galectin-3 protein

questions.correct_answer: D. Decreased ubiquitination of the Galectin-3 protein
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Decreased ubiquitination of the Galectin-3 protein

questions.text: Identify the correct statements: Priapism occurs due to cantharides. Histidine primarily acts as a buffer in blood due to its ability to accept and donate protons at physiological pH Keratan sulphate accumulates in Natowicz disease Sorbitol accumulation is linked to cataract in galactosemia
A female died due to unnatural cause within 7 years of marriage with allegation of dowry. The inquest will be done under which section?
Identify the slide given below?
Identify the plane in the given image:
Which of the following does not qualify as grievous hurt under the BNS?

A 67-year-old man with a 10-year history of Parkinson's disease is on levodopa/carbidopa therapy. Over the last few months, he has developed visual hallucinations and delusions. He denies suicidal ideation or harming others. His motor symptoms are well-controlled. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?

A 5-month-old boy is being evaluated for a hereditary metabolic disorder after presenting with failure to thrive and developmental delay. Physical examination reveals an abnormal head shape with a large anterior fontanelle and widely splayed cranial sutures. Profound hypotonia and hepatomegaly are also noted. Biochemical studies show elevated levels of very long chain fatty acids (VLCFAs) and phytanic acid. Cultured skin fibroblasts show impaired ability to oxidize VLCFAs. This patient's condition is best explained by dysfunction of which of the following cellular structures?

A 7-month-old girl is brought to the office due to irritability and regression of motor skills. The patient's birth was unremarkable, and her development had appeared normal, but she can no longer sit or roll over. Her parents have also noticed that she startles easily at loud noises. Head circumference measurement is consistent with macrocephaly. Fundus is shown below. Abdominal examination is normal. Accumulation of which of the following metabolites is most likely present in this patient's tissues?

A 5-day-old boy born to a 23-year-old woman is brought to the OPD for evaluation of poor feeding and vomiting. Physical examination reveals a lethargic newborn with exaggerated deep tendon reflexes and clonus. Further investigation reveals that the patient has an inherited condition that results in impaired transport of ornithine from the cytosol to the mitochondria. All of the following may be high in the patient except:
A patient came from a factory with a chemical injury to the eye a few hours back. Which is the first step in the management:

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department because of nausea and vomiting for 1 day. His maternal uncle had a seizure disorder and died in childhood. He appears fatigued. Respirations are 32/ min. Examination shows diffuse weakness in the extremities. Serum studies show a low pH, elevated lactate concentration, and normal blood glucose. A metabolic condition characterized by a defect in oxidative phosphorylation is suspected. Microscopic examination of a muscle biopsy specimen of this patient is most likely to show which of the following findings?

A young patient with acute psychosis is admitted to the hospital. He wakes up and asks for his wife, even though she is in the same room as him. When she is pointed out, he claims that she is not his wife and that she is being impersonated by someone else. What is the most likely diagnosis?

6-year-old boy presents with recurrent pneumonia. He passes frequent bulky greasy stools. On evaluation, the chloride concentration in his sweat is >60 mEq/L. Which of the following is most likely to be seen in this patient?

A 26-year-old male who was fired from his job 2 weeks back, presents with complaints of worrying excessively about his career when alone since then. His worrying decreases on engaging in activities such as reading novels and watching movies with his spouse. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 30-year-old man presents with complaints of excess uncontrollable worry over daily life activities, finance, and his health over the past 2 years. Because of this, he feels restless most of the time. He also complains of fatigue and disturbed sleep. Which of the following is the first-line drug for this patient?
Which of the following is the test for immediate memory?

options.label: A
options.text: Digit span forward up to 7 digits with 2 skips allowed

options.label: B
options.text: Serial (100-7) subtraction test up to 5 steps

options.label: C
options.text: Digit span backwards up to 5 digits with 2 skips allowed

options.label: D
options.text: Serial (20-1) subtraction test up to 5 steps

questions.correct_answer: A. Digit span forward up to 7 digits with 2 skips allowed

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with severe chest pain. He has had intermittent substernal chest pain for the past few months that typically occurs after heavy activity. Troponin is elevated, and ECG is shown below. After acute stabilization and treatment, further laboratory workup shows an increased serum methionine level. Which of the following amino acids is most likely essential in this patient?

Cholera toxin affects which of the following structures?

This is likely due to injury to auriculotemporal nerve. Common carotid artery divides at the level of lower border of thyroid cartilage Ansa cervicalis lies on the posterior wall of carotid sheath

An elderly female on immunosuppressant therapy presented with oral white patches which could be wiped off. On microscopy, it shows gram-positive budding yeasts cells and pseudohyphae. The Germ tube test was positive and it does not grow at 45°C. Identify the causative agent?

A patient was prescribed escitalopram. Which of the following adverse effect is the least likely?
A woman presents to the STI clinic with pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) and is given a yellow kit for herself and a kit for her husband. Which of the following kits will be given to her husband?
What are Kraissl’s lines?

options.label: C
options.text: Collagen and elastin lines in stab injury
